original: @238a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @238a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: dzam bha las'a dha nam /
analyzed: dzam bha las'a dha nam /
translated: Jambhalasādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dzam bha la'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: dzam bha la'i sgrub thabs /
translated: Jambhala's Means of Achievement

original: dpal ldan dzam bha la la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal ldan dzam bha la la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Jambhala.

original: sngon ma bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa rnam par bsams nas /
analyzed: sngon ma bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa rnam par bsams nas /
translated: Having contemplated the culmination of emptiness as before,

original: sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i steng du zla ba la dzam yig las skyes pa'i bcom ldan 'das dzam bha la bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i steng du zla ba la dzam yig las skyes pa'i bcom ldan 'das dzam bha la bsgom par bya ste /
translated: on top of a multicolored lotus with eight petals, on a moon, one should meditate on the Bhagavat Jambhala arisen from the letter jra.

original: gser gyi mdog can lta bu thung zhing lto ba 'phyad ba /
analyzed: gser gyi mdog can lta bu thung zhing lto ba 'phyad ba /
translated: He is like the color of gold, short, with a protruding belly,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /🔽g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i phyag @238b dag gis /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa / g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i phyag @238b dag gis /
translated: adorned with all the ornaments,🔽with left and right hands

original: sre mo dang b'i dza p'u ra ka bsnams pa /
analyzed: sre mo dang b'i dza p'u ra ka bsnams pa /
translated: holding a mongoose and a citron.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyis dbu brgyan pa /
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyis dbu brgyan pa /
translated: He is crowned with Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: autpa la'i phreng ba bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: autpa la'i phreng ba bsnams pa'o //
translated: He holds a garland of utpalas.

original: shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams su nor bu bzang po dang gang ba bzang po dang / nor sbyin dang rnam thos sras rnams so //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams su nor bu bzang po dang gang ba bzang po dang / nor sbyin dang rnam thos sras rnams so //
translated: On the petals beginning with the east are Sudhana, Puṇḍarīka, Vasurad, and Vaiśravaṇa.

original: me la sogs pa'i 'dab ma la ki li mi li dang / tsi pi kunda li dang / mu khendra dang / tsa rendra rnams so //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i 'dab ma la ki li mi li dang / tsi pi kunda li dang / mu khendra dang / tsa rendra rnams so //
translated: On the petals of fire and so forth are Kīlimālikā, Cīpākaṇṭhikā, Mukhendrī, and Carendrā.

original: de bzhin du ji ltar gsungs pa'i rim pas nor rgyun ma dang / chu shel ma dang / so legs ma dang / 'phags ma dang / shin tu bzang mo dang / sbas ma dang / lha mo dang / dbyangs can ma zhes te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar gsungs pa'i rim pas nor rgyun ma dang / chu shel ma dang / so legs ma dang / 'phags ma dang / shin tu bzang mo dang / sbas ma dang / lha mo dang / dbyangs can ma zhes te /
translated: In the same way, in the order taught, are Vasudā, Vāsukī, Puṣpadantī, Āryā, Subhadrā, Guhyā, Devī, and Sarasvatī.

original: gnod sbyin mo 'di rnams bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo 'di rnams bsam par bya'o //
translated: These yakṣiṇīs should be visualized.

original: nor rgyun ma ni dzam bha la dang lhan cig tu'o //
analyzed: nor rgyun ma ni dzam bha la dang lhan cig tu'o //
translated: Vasudā is together with Jambhala.

original: gnod sbyin mo rnams ni nor rgyun ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo rnams ni nor rgyun ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The yakṣiṇīs are like Vasudā.

original: gnod sbyin rnams dzam bha la bzhin te /
analyzed: gnod sbyin rnams dzam bha la bzhin te /
translated: The yakṣas are like Jambhala.

original: de bzhin du bsams nas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsams nas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having visualized them in this way, one should recite the mantras.

original: de la gnod sbyin rnams kyi sngags ni /
analyzed: de la gnod sbyin rnams kyi sngags ni /
translated: The mantras of the yakṣas are:

original: aom dzam bha la dza lendra ye sv'a h'a /🔽aom ma ni bha dra ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom dzam bha la dza lendra ye sv'a h'a / aom ma ni bha dra ye sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ jambhala jalenadraya svāhā.🔽Oṃ maṇibhadra-ya svāhā.

original: aom purna bha dra ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom purna bha dra ye sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ pūrṇabhadra-ya svāhā.

original: aom dha na d'a ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom dha na d'a ye sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ dhanadāya svāhā.

original: aom bee shra ma n'a yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom ki li mi ye sv'a h'a /🔽aom tsi bi kunda li yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom mu khendra ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom bee shra ma n'a yee sv'a h'a / aom ki li mi ye sv'a h'a / aom tsi bi kunda li yee sv'a h'a / aom mu khendra ye sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vaiśravaṇāya svāhā.🔽Oṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ kīliṃ mīṃ

original: aom tsa re ndra ye sv'a h'a /🔽de nas gnod sbyin mo rnams kyi sngags ni /🔽aom ba su dha r'a ye sv'a h'a /🔽aom tsandra kanta yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom dha na d'a yee sv'a h'a /🔽so su danta yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom a'a ry'a yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom su bha dr'a yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom gu pa ta yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom de b'i yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom sva ra sva t'i yee sv'a h'a /🔽de bzhin du thun mtshams gsum du bsgoms nas /🔽chu khyor ba brgya rtsa brgyad rab tu phul bas /🔽'jig rten gsum gyi mnga' ris ster bar 'gyur ro //🔽snga bar bya rog mi grag pa tsam na chu'i nang du bzlas na nor mi nyams shing 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aom tsa re ndra ye sv'a h'a /🔽de nas gnod sbyin mo rnams kyi sngags ni /🔽aom ba su dha r'a ye sv'a h'a /🔽aom tsandra kanta yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom dha na d'a yee sv'a h'a /🔽so su danta yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom a'a ry'a yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom su bha dr'a yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom gu pa ta yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom de b'i yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom sva ra sva t'i yee sv'a h'a /🔽de bzhin du thun mtshams gsum du bsgoms nas /🔽chu khyor ba brgya rtsa brgyad rab tu phul bas /🔽'jig rten gsum gyi mnga' ris ster bar 'gyur ro //🔽snga bar bya rog mi grag pa tsam na chu'i nang du bzlas na nor mi nyams shing 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Oṃ, to Cāriṇī, svāhā.🔽Next, the mantras of the yakṣiṇīs:🔽Oṃ, to Vasudharā, svāhā.🔽Oṃ, to Candrakantikā, svāhā.🔽Oṃ, to Dhanadā, svāhā.🔽Oṃ, to Sosudantā, svāhā.🔽Oṃ, to Āryā, svāhā.🔽Oṃ, to Subhadrā, svāhā.🔽Oṃ, to Gupaṭā, svāhā.🔽Oṃ, to Devī, svāhā.🔽Oṃ, to Svarasvatī, svāhā.🔽Thus, meditating in the three periods of the day,🔽and offering one hundred and eight handfuls of water,🔽one will be granted the wealth of the three worlds.🔽If one recites in the water at dawn, before the crows caw, one's wealth will not diminish but increase.

original: de nas gser la sogs pa'i snod du nor rgyun ma dang gnod sbyin lhan cig tu'o //
analyzed: de nas gser la sogs pa'i snod du nor rgyun ma dang gnod sbyin lhan cig tu'o //
translated: Then, in a vessel of gold, etc., [one should draw] Vasudharā together with the Yakṣas.

original: snod gnyis par bcom ldan 'das dzambha la gnod sbyin gyis yongs su bskor ba bris te yang dag par sbyar nas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: snod gnyis par bcom ldan 'das dzambha la gnod sbyin gyis yongs su bskor ba bris te yang dag par sbyar nas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In a second vessel, one should draw the Blessed One, Jambhala, surrounded by the Yakṣas. Having combined them, one should practice.

original: dngos grub chen po brgyad la sogs pa yang ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos grub chen po brgyad la sogs pa yang ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: [He] will grant the eight great accomplishments, etc.

original: dzambha la'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
analyzed: dzambha la'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
translated: The sādhana of Jambhala is complete.
